question_text:
Complete the process of solving the equation. Fill in the missing term on each line. Simplify any fractions.
5b + 7 = 7
5b = _
b = _
solution:
To complete the process of solving the equation, understand what changes from one line to the next.
Start at the top with the first and second lines.

To find the missing term, subtract 7 from both sides of the equation.
5b + 7 = 7
5b + 7 - 7 = 7 - 7
5b = 0
The missing term in the second line is 0.

Look at the second and third lines.
To find the missing term, divide both sides of the equation by 5.
5b = 0
5b/5 = 0/5
b = 0
The missing term in the third line is 0.

p = _
solution:
To complete the process of solving the equation, understand what changes from one line to the next.
Start at the top with the first and second lines.

To find the missing term, subtract 14 from both sides of the equation.
5p + 14 = 41
5p + 14 - 14 = 41 - 14
5p = 55
The missing term in the second line is 55.

Look at the second and third lines.
To find the missing term, divide both sides of the equation by 5.
5p = 55
5p/5 = 55/5
p = 11
The missing term in the third line is 11.

solution:

5v = -35
The missing term in the second line is -35.

Look at the second and third lines.
To find the missing term, divide both sides of the equation by 5.
5v = -35
5v/5 = -35/5
v = -7
The missing term in the third line is -7.
